forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. South southwest wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 6 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a muted palette of gray blankets the city, suggesting a quiet companionship with the rain poised to fall. The air carries the cool, refreshing scent of impending precipitation, a hint of moisture already settling on the streets. With a temperature hovering around the low fifties, the day ahead promises a high near fifty-eight, gradually fading as afternoon melts into evening. The chance of rain remains substantial, around seventy percent, urging those who step outside to be prepared for a gentle yet persistent drizzle.

Visibility may be affected today by a lurking marine layer, likely wrapping the hills and softening the outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge. Fog may find its way into the nooks and crannies of the city, creating an ethereal atmosphere that invites contemplation. To brave the elements, layering is the wise choice; a light jacket or a waterproof coat, even cozy scarves and thicker socks will enhance one's comfort against the wind that dances with gusts up to thirty-one mph. For those looking for indoor activities, consider wandering through the local art galleries, perhaps savoring a warm cup of coffee in a quaint café, where the rain can be observed from a cozy vantage point, transforming the ordinary into something undeniably poignant.
